Package org.zaproxy.zap.view

Class ComponentMaximiserMouseListener

java.lang.Object
java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
org.zaproxy.zap.view.ComponentMaximiserMouseListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, EventListener
public class ComponentMaximiserMouseListener extends MouseAdapter
A MouseListener that (un)maximises a component, when clicked twice, using a ComponentMaximiser.
Since:
2.5.0
See Also:
  • triggerMaximisation(Component)

  • Constructor Details

    • ComponentMaximiserMouseListener

      public ComponentMaximiserMouseListener(OptionsParamView viewOptions)
      Constructs a ComponentMaximiserMouseListener with the given view options.

      The view options to check (and update) if it's required a confirmation from the user to maximise the component.

      Parameters:
      viewOptions - the view options
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter viewOptions is null.
      See Also:
      • setComponentMaximiser(ComponentMaximiser)

    • ComponentMaximiserMouseListener

      public ComponentMaximiserMouseListener(OptionsParamView viewOptions, ComponentMaximiser componentMaximiser)
      Constructs a ComponentMaximiserMouseListener with the given view options and given component maximiser.

      The view options to check (and update) if it's required a confirmation from the user to maximise the component.

      Parameters:
      viewOptions - the view options
      componentMaximiser - the object responsible for maximising the component, might be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter viewOptions is null.

  • Method Details

    • setComponentMaximiser

      public void setComponentMaximiser(ComponentMaximiser componentMaximiser)
      Sets the ComponentMaximiser that will be used to maximise components. Might be null, in which case there will be no maximisation when a component is clicked twice.
      Parameters:
      componentMaximiser - the ComponentMaximiser that will be used to maximise components
      See Also:
      • getComponentMaximiser()
      • triggerMaximisation(Component)

    • getComponentMaximiser

      public ComponentMaximiser getComponentMaximiser()
      Gets the ComponentMaximiser that's used to maximise components.
      Returns:
      the ComponentMaximiser that's used to maximise the components, might be null
      See Also:
      • setComponentMaximiser(ComponentMaximiser)

    • mouseClicked

      public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent evt)
      Calls triggerMaximisation(Component) when clicked twice, with the source of the event as parameter.
      Specified by:
      mouseClicked in interface MouseListener
      Overrides:
      mouseClicked in class MouseAdapter

    • triggerMaximisation

      public void triggerMaximisation(Component component)
      Convenience method that programmatically triggers the (un)maximisation logic.

      If a component is already maximised it's unmaximised, otherwise it is maximised the given component. This is the same logic that's executed when a component is clicked twice, being the component the source of the mouse event.

      The call to this method has no effect if there's no ComponentMaximiser.

      Parameters:
      component - the component that will be maximised, if none is maximised already
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given component is null and there's no component maximised.
      See Also:
      • setComponentMaximiser(ComponentMaximiser)
